reviews.review:
Love their Mypies.... Too bad they haven't had them lately. Bring em back! 

.... Cookie Butter please
When the kids want a sweet treat other than frozen yogurt or ice cream, this is where we go! Never can go wrong! Lots of varieties and the service is good!

Great selection; any palate will be able to find an exact match for that sweet tooth. Great service; doesn't matter who helps or what time of day it is, you are always treated well, welcome and with a smile. Amazingly fresh; never once has anything ever tasted day old! Love this place!
Wow!  Great tasting every time!  Love everything I have ever tried!  Highly recommend!
Great cupcakes!!  I've tasted and retasted just to be sure. Friendly service. Would recommend.

Cute little bakery, with a ton of different flavor cupcakes. But my favorite is the butterscotch oatmeal cookies...they're the size of a plate. And best of all if you go about a half and hour before closing time, you can get them for half off.
BEST BEST BEST cupcake place in town! Unique flavors and pleasant staff. They even delivered a large order of cupcakes for our birthday party at Aria. They also make cookies that are CRAZY good!
We used Retro for our wedding cupcakes, and they were wonderful! Delivered to the reception venue on time and everything looked and tasted great! Would definitely use again.

Seriously some of the best cupcakes around! The cake is moist and the frosting is AMAZING! My favorites are the maple bacon and pink lemonade. Not only do they taste great, they are decorated beautifully.

Found the go-to bakery!!!!  Just moved to N. Las Vegas and am SO HAPPY we are close to Retro Bakery!  My husband grew up in a bakery and agrees this is the best we've found so far for cupcakes/cookies!  He loves butter cream.... I was never a big fan until now! Best cupcakes I've ever had and can't wait to try them all!  The sugar cookies were to die for as well....perfect balance between soft, chewy and flavorful!

Quick update while I'm writing reviews today...

THESE ARE STILL DELICIOUS..


Thanks, that is all.

First off I am surprised this place has lasted this long because the cupcakes are not yummy. But what this tells me is most people will settle for mediocre cupcakes or cakes in this valley which is great for Retro Bakery. They are way over priced for the quality of cupcake. The cake part taste like a cheap box mix and the icing is not about the buttercream.  My kids don't like the cupcakes either.  Won't recommend.

The BEST cupcakes I have ever had! I've tried many other cupcakes shops but Retro bakery has the most delicious, moist cupcakes I have tried so far. I'm not a huge cupcake fan but I find myself craving these babies all of the time. I know that everyone raves about their Buttercream, but I'm more of a cake person and Retro definitely delivers. The shop is pretty far from me, but if they were in Henderson, I would be in trouble. All of the flavors I've tried have been delicious. I will definitely be ordering my birthday cake from Retro this year.

I reviewed Retro Bakery last year and claimed that I was just not that impressed with the cupcakes themselves. The store is charming and the service can't be beat. Well, last month I had a craving for cupcakes and thought it would be fun to surprise the kids. So, I went back. Again, the service is great! They are so friendly there! This time I have to rave about the cupcakes. The cinnamon toast one was sooooo good that I actually dream about it. :)  The cupcakes just really hit the spot. Sure, I could make my own cupcake and it would be similar to their cupcakes. But I cannot duplicate their buttter cream and that is where the magic is. I've been having to practice great will power not to drive over there every week!

these are the most tasty cupcakes i've had in a while. i just tried 2 cupcakes from Retro Bakery...the Hop Scotch and the Chocolate Covered Banana. mmm they were moist & creamy...i was expecting the Hop Scotch to be super sweet, but it was just right. i like the whole style of the bakery and the menu items and i can't wait to go back to try some more...i just wish it were closer to my house!

When they say all about the butter cream, they ain't lying. It is delicious! I have gone to multiple (famous) other bakeries and haven't found one that even compares to here.  The flavors here are amazing. My favorite so far is Hopscotch, Chocolate fountain, Cherry Cheesecake, Pucker Up and I think its called Snazzleberry(?) their new April flavor. My weddings at the end of the month and they are going to be the cake and cupcake providers. I'll update how that goes.

Picked up 15 cupcakes to go. They were amazing! They close at 7pm and I dropped in at 6pm they still had a great selection of cupcakes.  

When we finally at the 2 hours later they were delicious! They were moist and so tasty! I had butterscotch which was sooooo good! I also sampled bites other strawberry/vanilla, peanut butter chocolate, pumpkin seasonal special, everything was phenomenal. The girls in the front were really friendly and they have a loyalty program.   If your in Northwest LV check this place out delicious cupcakes;)

These cupcakes are the most delicious cupcakes I have ever eaten. The presentation and texture of all of the different cupcake flavors are wonderful and playful. I loved the dense frosting and moist cake. They paired very well. The flavors available will satisfy most picky "Desserters." A word I just made up to describe those who love dessert more than dinner. If you find yourself with some time to kill on your trip to Las Vegas, this is the place to go. It's a bit out of the way, but if you're sober and adventurous, it will be worth the time and trip. The Milk and Cookies cupcake is the Key.

Found out about Retro from a friend of mine, one day this picture of delicious cupcakes appears on my screen and from that moment I was curious. I'm a HUGE fan of cupcakes, maybe that's putting it lightly. I'm obsessed with them. big, small, edible and non-edible I love them all. So since moving to Vegas i've tried to seek out the "best cupcake in town" so I decided to give Retro a try. And let me tell you what i'm glad I did. Retro's cakes are AH-MAZING! The flavors are great, the cakes are moist and the frostings are on point. My favorites are the coconut, hop scotch(butterscotch), and the blueberry pancake. The other flavors are awesome too, there's different specials on different days so check their website for the up to date flavor list. Even though it's way up in the NW it's worth the trip to get some delicious baked goods!! www.retrobakerylv.com
Very good assortment of cupcakes, with some unusual ones.  I've tried three flavors and they are yummy.  Good chocolate chip cookies too.

Been here 3 times now and love this place! So far every time I have come the cupcakes have been moist and delicious.  

My personal opinion I don't get the hype over the Hop Scotch cupcake that is their bestseller and I wasn't a fan of their Red Carpet, but everything else I have tried has been great! 

Little disappointed they don't have a customer stamp card for return customers but they do have email sign up to receive deals and specials that way.

Let's just say the cupcakes looked a lot prettier than they tasted. I picked out 8 assorted options... My favorite one was the seasonal pumpkin. The most disappointing one was a Carmel chocolate one with chopped peanuts. Both myself and my mother thought that one was going to be the yummiest since we both love nuts in our sweets but the peanuts had a stale taste. The frosting was too sweet for my taste as well.

Great variety of cupcakes! I personally love the Maple Bacon, because it's so different! While my hubby likes to keep it simple with the classic Retro cupcake. For those naysayers that complain about the price, I think the price is fair for what you are getting because they homemade with lots of love and no preservatives! Plus I would much rather support a locally run family friendly small business any day, even if it does mean I have to pay a bit more for a little piece of heaven :) But, they are sweet, I will agree with that, that is why, even though we live within walking distance, we rarely indulge in Retro goodies, because we can't handle the sweetness overload unless it is a special occasion!

Totally awese.  I ordered my wedding cake from out of town without ever sampling, so it was a risk.  I got the buttercream with cinnamon and it was a hit!  They delivered to our hotel and it was just like I had asked for...better actually!  We loved the cake, and the cupcakes, and escpecially the friendly owners.  Thanks!  Only wish they would open a store in Austin now!
Love love love every yummy treat I've had from here.  Owner and staff are friendly and helpful.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone with a sweet tooth.

I ordered cupcakes and a 9" cake from Retro for my wedding in 2009.

I did a LOT of research on the internet (since I live in Indiana!) on the best place for cupcakes in Vegas. Time and again, people chose Retro.

Kari and Brian were super helpful. I didn't want a lot of fuss, but I knew I wanted cupcakes and a cake that went with our themes - an Elvis wedding and our reception in an Irish Pub (we met on St. Patty's day).

They made us an Elvis "record" cake with lemon cake and mixed up the cupcakes with lemon, chocolate and vanilla with an adorable sugar shamrock on top. Kari even tried to honor my wish for cream cheese frosting on the record cake (no dice though, it didn't set well enough).

I'm not much for frosting, so I don't get the whole MOUNDS of buttercream concept but the cake was delicious. I loved it so much that when I couldn't find a fork the day after our wedding, I just picked it up and ate it!

The prices were more than reasonable and I felt completely confident that everything would be perfect. Thank you Retro!

Love Love Love Retro Bakery!  I've tried my share of cupcakes and haven't been overly impressed in what Vegas has to offer.  There are a couple places around that I love every cupcake I've tried and Retro is definitely one.  

Not too long ago, I had someone at my door.  To my surprise when I opened it, I had a dozen of the best looking cupcakes being delivered.  There isn't much to say about these cupcakes.  Delicious yet simple.  The combination of the rich icing and moist cake is perfect!  The cookies and cream is by far the best!

I really love cupcakes! My favorite here is the pistachio. My only thing I could say I don't like is too much butter cream frosting. I usually take off half of it then it's perfect! The cake itself is a bit dense. It's great in cupcake size but a whole cake is a bit much for me. The girls that work here are lovely.

I ordered a custom cake for my daughter's 3rd birthday from Retro in August. The theme for her party was definitely not typical, but they were able to accommodate my request and replicated the image that I sent over perfectly!  The price point was better than 3 other bakeries I had contacted.  I chose to have the cake delivered.  When Brian arrived with the cake, the color of the frosting border wasn't what I had specified.  He offered to take the cake back to the store, fix it, and have it back in time for the party!  This was definitely above and beyond and we truly appreciated how awesome they treat their customers.

 The cake we chose was white cake with almond buttercream and it was seriously AMAZING!  All of the guests at the party commented on how delicious it was and asked where we had ordered it from.  Because of the quality of their product and the outstanding customer service, Retro has gained a loyal customer!
It is always a pleasure going in to Retro Bakery! Love the bakery, Love the cupcakes, Love the pies, and LOVE the owners!

This is an adorable cupcakery. The owners are sweet and cute, too. I'm not a cupcake expert, but I can't help but to think that my tastebuds don't lie...and they say that Retro Bakery is the best! I love every flavor, except the one that has bacon. Somehow, I feel like I wasted the opportunity to eat a decadent, delicious treat when I eat that one. Conversely, I'd have to say that my favorite one is the cookies and cream, because you get two treats in one! I always get at least a 4-pack of cupcakes, even though it's very dangerous to have that many around at one time. I always end up eating all of them within two days, lol! At least I only go there for special occassions...Retro Bakery is a special place! P.S. They are teacher-friendly, which I appreciate!

I try and make it out to retro as much as possible, which unfortunately is just not enough because I live on the other side of the world practically.  Anyway I love reading these reviews that basically say this place is amazing if you like sweets, but I don't so here's 2 stars. The tagline is It's all about the buttercream, so your probably not going to go in expecting something savory.  IT'S SWEET SWEETNESS at it's best.  

Honestly I can't remember the first time I visited. I might of had a coupon from a book or something. That's usually how I end up trying places. Anyway I am glad I did because they have the best cupcakes   .      I've been to other places in town with cupcakes and nothing compares to the variety, flavor, and ratio of cake to cream.  

Maple Bacon is the business here.  I get at least one every time I visit.  The chocolate fountain for chocoholics is also amazing. Milk and cookies is great too. Each month they have a special cupcake they produce and many of them are amazing, and some are not as amazing lol. HOW MANY TIMES CAN I USE AMAZING IN A REVIEW?! 

Ok so if you sign up for the Eclub you get an email every month with the flavors that are in, the flavors that are out and a special 1 day out of the month deal where you can get some cupcakes as cheap as a DOLLAR each.  Also on Saturdays (I hope this is still in effect because I'm off this saturday) they have these LOADED chip cookies for like 1.50 each. They are ginormous(spell check did not go off for ginormous, that is awesome), and I swear there are more chips (chocolate, white chocolate, butterscotch, and peanut butter) in them then there is cookie. 

As a final note, the staff is always really friendly when I go. I've visited on several occasions and bought a cupcake for a friend's bday and they are nice and put a happy birthday plastic stick type thingy, whatever its called on it.    =)

Sweet mercy!

I ordered my wedding cake from Retro Bakery. After emailing Brian back and forth a few times, we came up with a design that we thought would look cool and went for it.

I didn't get to see the cake before I got to my venue, but when  I walked in and saw it sitting there, I was stunned. It was even more beautiful than I could have pictured it. People came up to us all during dinner commenting on how amazing it looked.

But then everyone started telling us they didn't like wedding cake, because wedding cakes don't taste good. 

Those folks all got a HUGE suprise when we cut into that cake. It was freaking AMAZEBALLS DELICIOUS! We got three layers, each a different flavour. The cookies and cream cake went like hotcakes, the cherry cheesecake was devoured and the peanut butter cup, well, let's just say that one almost didn't get served because that was the one I cut into and I almost ate the entire layer myself. 

I wish I had a picture right now to post, because it was seriously the coolest wedding cake I have ever seen. I might be biased, but whatever, it was my cake and it was amazing. I have leftovers so I will be sitting here in my pajamas today eating wedding cake for breakfast.

I ordered a dozen cupcakes from Retro Bakery to celebrate my one year anniversary with my boyfriend. I arranged with Brian to have them delivered to our hotel, the MGM Grand. He was very friendly on the phone and seemed delighted that I wanted to order cupcakes for our special occasion from his shop. He didn't seem to mind too much that I kept calling back to change/confirm my order.

The cupcakes were delivered the morning after our arrival in Vegas. Brian delivered them himself, with an adorable child in tow. The cupcakes arrived Saran-wrapped in a large white box with a clear top, instantly inducing drool. The buttercream was light and fluffy without being overly supermarket bakery toothache sugary and was applied in a perfect dollop. The glazed Coffee and Donuts one was my favorite. A DONUT and COFFEE in one! I didn't care for the Cinnamon Toast and the Hop Scotch was just a little too sweet but for the most part, they were excellent.

I will definitely order more when I go back!

Tried this place out because of the awesome reviews. I have to say I'm not impressed for a couple reasons.

1) When we first entered we were very excited and had good energy. Workers were so dead. We were saying how we were so juiced to try their cupcakes because of the rave reviews only to have blank stares. Wow. Cupcakes are supposed to be fun not depressing.

2) Cupcakes are gorgeous but oh-so-bland like the workers. It was so disappointing. All I taste is super sweet frosting and nothing else. The cupcakes were very inconsistent in texture. One was dry another was so moist I think it wasn't cooked all the way. 

My partner and I got 2 cupcakes each. All different flavors. We couldn't even finish 1 because of the extremely sweet frosting overpowering everything. Took a bite from the other 2 to see if it would be different. Nope. I am being very generous with my 2 stars feeling that the overall experience was bad. Bad attitudes to match the bad cupcakes. There goes $10 we could have used on Starbucks. My partner says, "Starbucks is worth the calories. These aren't." LOL. With that said, if you love sweet to the point of tooth ache and rot, this is your spot.

Hello. I go here all the time to get the kids the wonderful cupcakes and cookies. I decided to order a cake for my son's birthday because the cupcakes were so good. That being said the cake tasted wonderful and turned out great.  Brian was great to deal with. The process to get there was not a very easy one. The ordering and payment process was very confusing. I don't think the staff communicated with each other on what was needed and seemed just as confused as I was. The manager is condescending and they didn't seem to know what was going on. Will I order another cake from here? Probably not...there are too many other bakeries to choose from who would have made the process easier.

Such a cool little cupcake oasis in the Las Vegas desert! Visiting this bakery was definitely one of the highlights of my trip to Vegas. I was impressed by the presentation in the display case and also with the flavor assortment. I visited at the end of August so some of the choices we had were : iced tea, chocolate loves chocolate, cotton candy, pink lemonade... I picked up a box of one dozen and took them with me to a get-together with family and they were a hit! 

Kari, the owner, offered top-notch customer service. I guarantee I'll be back many more times in the future.

I was first introduced to Retro Bakery from the gf when she decided to surprise me with some melt in your mouth cupcakes on New Years Eve.  It's obvious to Yelpers that know her that she has a sweet tooth.  But you know what?...I just discovered that I have one too.  Prior to actually visiting Retro, I've sampled the Red Carpet (Red Velvet), Glazed Donut, and Peanut Butter Cup Cupcakes.  Needless to say, I couldn't wait to get more.  


My Review: 
-Glazed Donut:  Tasted exactly like it's named.  If you love donuts (glazed ones) and love cupcakes (good ones), then their Glazed Donut needs to be on your list. 

-Red Carpet:  I only got a little taste and I know it's red velvet, but it's the buttercream that I will never forget.  The buttercream has the perfect texture & sweetness for anything red velvet. 

-Peanut Butter Cup:  Oh Boy...my favorite.  And Yes, I do love me some peanut butter.  That being said...if this wasn't good, I'd say it.  At Retro, they managed to combine a creamy peanut butter to a fluffy chocolate cupcake.  So Good!!  Just curious...how much better would this cupcake be if it was on a vanilla cake?  So far so good...this is just a wishlist.

-Salted Caramel:  Just had a small sample recently and gots to say...this can rival the Peanut Butter Cup.  

-Peanut Butter Chocolate Chunk:  This is cookie, not a cupcake.  I couldn't resist on my visit here.  I haven't found the perfect Peanut Butter Cookie, but Retro's is pretty damn close.  

Looking for some moist, fresh, and cupcakes with style, then give Retro Bakery a shot.  Maybe it's a good thing that I'm not on this side of town too often.  My belly would go broke.  But when I'm craving some peanut butter cupcakes and cookies, I sure know where to go.
I dont know I was spoiled in SF. We had cupcakes with guts, gooey bits in the inside. Cupcakes in Vegas seem to be mostly a base for some tasty frosting options.  Depth is needed.  The kids liked it.

So I'd love to give Retro a good review but I can't. I'm getting married in Las Vegas in August and a friend of mine who was vacationing in Vegas brought me a dozen cupcakes from their bakery to taste. Most of them were yummy.... even though they had traveled from Vegas to Los Angeles. The problem is not the cupcakes.... it's the staff and their willingness to accommodate the customer. 

My wedding is on a Sunday afternoon, Retro Bakery is not open on Sunday. I was told they would deliver the night before to the reception restaurant. I found out this week that the reception restaurant cannot accept baked goods a day in advance due to the health code. I asked Retro what I could do to get their cupcakes at my reception and rather than having someone come in and deliver on Sunday (which would take all of maybe an hour) to make a sale and a happy customer.... they told me to ask the hotel I was staying in if they would keep the cupcakes in one of their refrigerators overnight and then I would have to get someone to transport them to the restaurant. Excuse me? I'm paying $400 for cupcakes (it's only sugar and flour people!) only to have to schlep around a hotel in Vegas to get them to my reception? I think Retro could care less about their customers.... they think they are way too cool for school. I found another bakery that not only delivers in Vegas on Sundays but they also don't charge for delivery and set up (unlike Retro).... Sorry, maybe I'm not cool enough for Retro but I think with the way the economy is today that something as small as a delivery should be workable. This is the first review I have made on Yelp.... I just thought people should know that Retro will not go out of their way for their customers....

I ordered 24 cupcakes of various colors and flavors for my daughters 9th bday. EVERY ONE OF THEM was perfect! No mess ups, even though my order was somewhat complicated. The cake portion was RIDICULOUSLY GOOD and the chocolate frosting with sprinkles was just sinful....So happy!!! Will be using them again!!!!

I give nothing but props to these butter cream slingen hand held cake making mother f@%ers. These little cakes are an explosion of yummyness in your mouth. I catered cupcakery for my wedding and damn I wish Retro was around 4 years ago. I crave nothing more then a milk and cookies at 10am in the morning after a night of drunkeness. My husband creams his pants when it comes to the pucker up  maple bacon. I do love the maple bacon as well, but unlike my husband, I'm still dry. I do looove the cookies and milk or salted pretzel crunch. All I can say is damn you Retro for planting yourselves next to 711... BRAVO. The only downer is if you don't get there before 2ish you have slim pickins. Good for them, bad for me.

Kari and Brian....you rocked my world!!
Your cupcakes are legit and so are you!

We ordered 6 dozen assorted cupcakes for our Las Vegas wedding.  I couldn't make up my mind on what I wanted so I said...you pick. 
They were the best damn cupcakes I have ever had in my entire life.   
We even picked up a couple for breakfast...maple bacon and glazed donut.....best breakfast I have ever had!

Kari was actually working the counter when we walked in.  She made us feel welcome...like we were regular customers.  She even gave me some words of encouragement about opening my own bakery some day (on the other side of the country.....there is no way I could compete with Retro).

I can't wait to go back!  We are already planning a trip in December!

I love this place. The cupcakes are the best I ever had from a bakery. I like the cotton candy, and  the retro cupcakes. Homemade butter cream and everything is always fresh! It's a must for anyone in the area

This bakery is truly as good as it gets.

They generously donated to a charity event that I worked on...and the oohs and ahhs went on all night long.

People raved about these cupcakes all night long ...and why wouldn't they? The frosting was fabulous, lots of variety and the cake tasted super fresh. Peanut butter, hopscotch, chocolate...you name it and it is divine!

Super owners and a great staff make this one of the top bakeries in town!

Hold the phone. Seriously WTF is with this nearly 5 star rating for this place? I am totally cool supporting local businesses, but local doesn't make this 5 stars.

I should preface this review that I've worked in bakeries, so I've made my fair share of cupcakes & I understand that bakery work isn't a walk in the park. I live nearby so I decided to treat my siblings to cupcakes after dinner tonight. 

We ended up with:
-Peanut butter chocolate - frosting tastes like incredibly sweet peanut butter. Cake tastes like a bland wacky cake.

-Lemon Raspberry - sister said it had zero raspberry flavor and that the frosting tasted like the smell of lemon scented bathroom cleaner.

-Glazed doughnut - brother said it tasted like just plain white cake mix.

- Hopscotch - sister (she's 9) liked the frosting, despite it being so sweet it could make you squint but said the cake part tasted like nothing.

We all sampled each cupcake, so I can attest to the validity of my siblings' critiques.

Frosting is so sweet that it is inedible and the cake tastes like nothing at all. I was expecting some intense, quality flavors. I didn't taste a hint of butter for a business whose tagline is "it's all about the buttercream."

While I'm happy to support a local business with my money and the cupcakes looked gorgeous, the cupcakes themselves were not as good as even a boxed mix and the frosting is too sweet - very unbalanced.

Wow, this place is far for Vegas standards for Cali not so far but my friends who are Vegas locals were complaining. Anyway, I'm glad I dealt with their nags because they stopped nagging after trying the cupcakes. We ordered the cookies and cream (the frosting tasted exactly like a cookies and cream but being buttercream it was surprisingly perfectly made because it would have been easy to make it too sweet but instead it was perfect amount of sweetness with the exact flavor of cookies and cream), cinnamon toast (tasted like the cinnamon toast crunch w/ french toast texture), pink lemonade (was a good surprise it was the perfect amount of citrus lemon flavor with a good balance of sweetness), peanut butter cup (my fav the frosting was like a blended nutterbutter not too have on the peanut butter but not too sweet also it was amazing and combined with a perfect chocolate cake it was totally reeses pieces cake), and maple bacon (wow, bacon pieces in the cake and a crumbled topping it was a pleasant surprise and it was exactly what makes breakfast plate of french toast, maple syrup and bacon it was insanely good and perfect representation of breakfast without being too sweet and the cake was great with bacon bits, try it you won't be disappointed). There were cupcakes I really wanted to try to they were mostly sold out no surprise but I will come back for sure when I go back to Vegas!

They pride themselves in their buttercream frosting and I'm not a frosting girl but a cake needs frosting and let me tell you they've made some great frostings only to accompany moist well flavored cake. Alone the frosting would be great and the cake alone is also great. =)

I think their cupcakes are cheap for the quality of their cupcakes. Try it you won't be disappointed.

The people that work there are very friendly and easy to talk to and we were only there for a few minutes. Nice people! Thanks for the cupcakes! We love it!

Tip keep it in room temp.
Their cupcakes are delicious!  I've only had the butterscotch and chocolate ones, and I'm dying to try their other flavors!  Their mini cupcakes are really cute too.
Always so yummy and good.. Never had a bad experience with food or the people. Such a cute place! Can't stay away.. Good hidden gem!!

Far and away the best cupcakes in Vegas! Perfectly moist, dense, with refreshing yummy buttercream. My personal favorite is the Pucker Up-- a vanilla cupcake with raspberries in it and lemon buttercream. The strawberry buttercream is fantastic too. Cakes are very reasonably priced too! The owners are super nice and grateful to their customers-- this is exactly the kind of shop you should be proud to support!

Love, love, love Retro Bakery! Their cupcakes are amazing as well as their cookies! I try to incorporate their treats into anything I'm planning at work. At the most recent event everyone raved about their cookies and cupcakes. My personal favorites are the cinnamon cookie and the chocolate fountain cupcake. I can't wait to have another one. And to top it off, the owners are super friendly and really make you feel welcome in the store.

Best cupcakes ever. I've been to many cupcake places around the country, hands down this is the best. Just wish they were closer to the strip & had longer hours on the weekend. Still worth the 20 min. one-way drive. The cake is the most moist & dense cupcake I've had. High quality, baked from scratch taste. These cupcakes are what other cupcakes aspire to be. The only con is once you have these other cupcakes seemed watered down in comparison.

OMG the cupcakes are awesome! I'm the type of person who usually won't spend money on a cupcake. I just can't  bring myself to do it. I can bake a whole batch of cupcakes for the price of one. But my fiance and I were visiting different bakeries to find a wedding cake, and Retro had such great reviews that we decided to visit. The cupcakes are so good, and we liked so many of them, that we decided to do a cupcake tower instead of a wedding cake so that our guests can choose what flavor(s) they want. :-)  They are a small shop, so you do have to be patient if you're calling ahead or emailing, but the employees are all very friendly. So far, my favorite is the Hop Scotch (and I'm usually a total chocolate person), but several others were a close second. I will update the review after our wedding. :-)

Freakin' adorable cupcakes served by the nicest people.  Decently priced compared to other cupcake joints.  The Hop Scotch.  All these things helped bump Retro Bakery up to four stars.

As much as I want to be butt-crazy in love with this place, I really can't.  The cake has a great consistency- not too dense but not falling apart, either.  But the icing is just way, way too sweet for me.  When I have one of these cupcakes I have to share (gasp!) because I'm afraid I'm going to upset my stomach.

I've tried several flavors, the most recent being chocolate/peanut butter frosting, vanilla/salted caramel frosting, and a cookies 'n cream.  I hate to say it, but the flavors of all these frostings really didn't come through.  Not enough peanut butter flavor, not enough caramel (and zero salt).... You get the picture.  The only cupcake that tastes amazing to me every time is the Hop Scotch.  There's loads of flavor from the butterscotch and it pairs nicely with the vanilla cupcake.  But again, I have to share so I don't get an instant cavity.

So, as for the cupcakes I'm going to say they are A-Ok and worth three stars.  The fact I really enjoy the Hop Scotch and that they are a friendly, small shop gives them four.

I'm a fan of my cupcake place back home in Cali but my LV friends kept raving about Retro so I finally made it into town before they closed up shop for the day.

My taste buds were happy, I'll tell ya. I should have wrote this review sooner because I don't remember the flavors I got but I know they were great. They do not sell minis unless by pre-order.

I thnk it is the frosting that won me over. It's wonderful. The cake itself was above average but not mouth-watering good. I recommend highly and I will be back next time I'm in town. (two weeks) :)

I found Retro Bakery through Yelp and didn't realize the bakery was less than a couple minutes away from my old place.  So when I arrived, I told Kari and Brian (the owners and super nice people) that I found them through Yelp and they were really excited.  They even introduced me to their neighbors and daughters that were hanging around for them to close the store.  I loved how the bakery had a great family atmosphere.

Now what matters most...the cupcakes.  I tried the red velvet and donut ganache.  I've had better with the red velvet: the cake had a wierd after taste but the buttercream made up for it.  But as for the donut ganache, OMG, so so so so good!  I love donuts and I love cupcakes, so to combine the two together was just genius.  Unfortunately, I don't live as close anymore but I definitely recommend this place for their super-friendly enviornment and their other creative-flavored cupcakes.  :)

The fiancé and I walk in completely eager, because we are in the shopping center four out of seven days in the week, and Retro Bakery is closed every time. I'm excited. These are cupcakes. The finger appetizers of overweight gods. I run up and begin to eye everything I want, as well as what my family would like. A lot of their selection is out, but we did come literally half an hour before they close. Understandable. 

Their cupcakes are visually stunning. We take a dozen. Churro, Apple Cider, Maple Bacon, Chocolate Fountain (x2), Peanutbutter Cup (x2), Glazed Donut, Drumstick, and two I cannot recall the names of (I think Raspberry Lemonade and the March Flavor of The Month x2). $29.95, if I recall correctly.

Unfortunately these are a hit or miss for me. They either wow me, or are nearly inedible. The Chocolate Fountain was not good at all. The buttercream was so overwhelming, and the cake was just dry and tasteless. It's almost too much sweet...and that, in my case, is a very rare and unusual statement. The same goes for the Raspberry Lemonade (or whatever the yellow one was). There was a distinct lacking in the flavor of the cake itself; overpowered by the buttercream.  

The March Flavor of The Month was very good. The cake was amazing and moist. The frosting was a little stale, but it was tasty. It had a carrot cake frosting, and the cake itself had some delicious nuts with a very subtle vanilla flavor. Awesome. 

The Drumstick looked great! Stunning visual appearance! My father loves the actual ice cream cones, so I definitely wanted to grab him one. He said it was alright. It didn't really appeal to him, as the name and appearance had. It was just vanilla, but it was moist and sweet. 

I don't know what was up with the Maple Bacon. I was excited because reaching outside of a comfort zone in baking is always fun and impressive. But...only when you do it right. My fiancé took one solid bite and placed it back in the box. The flavors were a good attempt, but the textures of the toppings mixed with the buttercream just didn't work for us. And the actual "maple" taste was a bit overwhelming. 

I haven't tried the Churro, Apple Cider, or Peanutbutter yet. But I will definitely update and edit my review based upon their flavor and overall execution. Five stars for appearance! So far, two for actual taste.
If cupcakes made you skinny, I would eat here every day! I can't say enough good things about this Retro Bakery. Delicious cupcakes and kind staff!

Okay, this is bad that this place is down the road from me. I am a bit picky when it comes to cupcakes. Frosting ratio to cake, cake fluffiness and softness to dense. Flavor, of course. You cannot go wrong here. I advise you to try to cookie dough, it's just divine! Damn, it's 6pm and I missed today's hours. See you guys tomorrow!
ordered a few birthdays for my kids  never been deceived by theses good quantities very yummy cupcakes :)

Been there three times and have tried a variety of cupcakes.  Flavor was  good, service great, very nice people work there, but out of the dozen or so cupcakes I had gotten, about half were either stale or just not very good. The staff is great in that you can write to them and share your feedback and they will give you a coupon for a free cupcake. But who has time for that. Plus at $2.50 a pop, they should be fresh.  Will try a couple more times since i live close and want to support small local business.

I decided to make the detour from the Strip to try Retro Bakery after reading some really great reviews while we were visiting from California.  And I have to say that those great reviews were absolutely right!

As soon as my husband, 7-year-old son and I entered the bakery we were greeted so warmly by Brian Haskell (co-owner) and he stood with us and looked at the display case, recommending some of his favorites.

It took us a while to decide on our 2 cupcakes each (not easy to do with a 7-year-old) and then Kari Haskell (co-owner) came out from the kitchen and chatted with us.  She was very friendly and great in interacting with our son.  The prices were great...a reasonable $2.65 for one cupcake.

The cupcakes?  They were AMAZING!  I had the Hopscotch, which was very good, right away.  I took an Apple Cider cupcake for later.  My son had the Cotton Candy (I tasted the frosting which really did taste like cotton candy) and the Cookies and Cream, both of which he loved.  My husband had the Chocolate Fountain and the Pucker Up.  Both were very, very good.  Later on I shared my Apple Cider cupcake with my husband and we both agreed that it's the best cupcake we've ever had (and we try just about every cupcake place we can find!)

We returned 3 days later and ALL ordered the Apple Cider cupcakes and each got a second for "the road."  I had the Pucker Up and my son chose the Pink Lemonade (very good frosting!).  My husband had the Brownie Sundae cupcake.  All were very good.  We also got two Frosting Shots of Mint Buttercream.  That frosting was the perfect combination of mint and cream flavors.  Very smooth and rich.

We agreed, yet again, that the Apple Cider cupcake is still the best we've ever had.  We will definitely visit the Retro Bakery again next time we are in the Las Vegas area!

I have to be honest, my five star rating isn't for the product. I had heard a bit about this place and as a desserts maniac, I was in the area so I figured I would stop in, as it is quite a ways up there in the northwest side. It was a lot of cupcakes, which is weird for a "bakery". But they are known for them so I figured I would try it.

Overall, the cupcakes were very sizable and fairly priced but they were soooooo sweet. Wow. Felt like my teeth might melt off. 

In all fairness, many people like sweet cupcakes, so I can't really fault them. If they have been in business this long, they have something figured out with what people like. 

The reason for my rating is mainly the customer service. They are literally some of the nicest people I have ever met. You can tell they take pride in their store and know what they're doing. I think they have some really creative cupcakes and while I probably can't go back for my personal dessert needs, these are definitely the kind of unique cool cupcakes you can bring to a party and all the sugar addicts will lose their minds.

It would be 5 if I had a fresh cupcake. Icing was a little stale but probably from sitting out in the case all day. Still good though. I had the strawberry banana cupcake and my nephews murdered the pink lemonade. I still have two more and I'm sure they'll be great!

This review is "to be continued"...but I wanted to start my review before I forget anything. It's St Patrick's Day, my oven is out, and we have a party to go to tonight! I searched for bakeries in my area and Retro came up, I called them and asked if they had flavors that I was interested in, they did, so I jumped in the car and race down there. 

Pros:
Cute shop, friendly staff, creative flavors. 

I miss understood the website, and that they had mini cupcakes available also, but they are on special request. I decided to get 2 dozen cupcakes, 6 of each:
Salted caramel, Hop scotch, Mint chocolate chip, and the St Pattys vanilla with mint butter cream. They only had 5 of the caramel (bummed) so we threw in a loner (can't remember what flavor.) 

Cons:
From the photo you can see that they are not even. I bake a lot, and make sure things are beautiful for my guests. When I have bought in the past, food looks professional. @ $30 a dozen I expect beauty and good flavor.  I got home to set up my trays, and was upset when I open the boxes and saw how sloppy the frosting job was on each of them. In the display case the frosting was all faced forward so they all look the same. But when I got home the frosting was half hanging off of some of the cupcakes. I don't know any kids, or adults that would go up to a tray of desserts and say to themselves "oooh! I want the one with the frosting falling off!" I love unique shops, try to support them, but... 

So this is "to be continued", I'll let you know if everyone thinks they're yummy!
This place rules. Consistent retro/hip theme in their execution. Lots of sweetness on top balanced by the cake on bottom.

I ordered a dozen cupcakes to have at my sisters bachelorette party. I found retro bakery from online reviews so I wanted to leave my own review to help other people out. Well, they delivered to my hotel on the strip and the driver texted me when he was on his way and he was so wonderful. I met him right in the lobby and it was so easy! And the cupcakes were the best I've ever had! I've eaten a good amount of cupcakes, specifically, ones that are "so delicious" they got their own tv show...ahem, Georgetown cupcake....these cupcakes from Retro were so much better! And, unfortunately, our plans changed and we weren't able to eat them the day of, but they were still delicious the next day! They must be even better the day of. I got 4 different flavors and the funfetti and the chocolate peanut butter were the two favorites. Wish they had another location in my city!

This bakery does NOT have cheesecakes. Maybe you should REMOVE it from your best cheesecake is Las Vegas list? This is very misleading. They only sell cupcakes, which I can't stand, so cannot comment on that. No sitting area though, despite some of the other reviews, it's just take your cupcakes and go.

Awesome!!

Retro Bakery just shot up my list of top cupcakes in Las Vegas. If you don't believe me, try some yourself!

Always on the hunt for anything bakery, I came across Retro Bakery on Yelp. I did see a few people had written some Stella reviews on this business, so after doing some recon from the NorthWest Yelp Crew Ty W and Mary S, I made my way to Retro with little care for my cavities.

Located on North Durango drive, in North West Las Vegas. Retro Bakery has established itself in a small strip mall. When locating it using your conventional smart phone it will be a little odd in how it displays the route, so keep your eyes peeled.

Once Inside I was greeted by very helpful young lady, being my first time she went through everything that was on display and pricing. Very helpful. I ended up with a half dozen.
2x Red velvet
1x Cotton candy
1x Drumstick
1x Cupcake of the month (pretty much chocolate overload)
1x cookie cupcake

After a sample of each and I was not disappointed!!! Each had that smooth fluffy texture with an explosion of flavor.

Although I didn't look into it much more, it  seemed like they had custom cakes for purchase as well. Something I might have to look into in the future.

If your living over this side of town and are needing birthday or just any old reason to get something sweet, Retro Bakery seems to be the place to come. 


Overall
Service: 4-5
Food: 5-5
Cleanliness: 5-5
Coming back: Yes

So back in 2011 I went to Retro Bakery for my wedding cake since they were close instead of the bakery near the wedding reception location. I paid a decent amount for my cake and its was dry and not very good. The design, colors and flowers were all wrong so I called to complain and all they did was say sorry?? I'm not the type of person to complain to company's but I was so disappointed because it was my wedding cake...  Not no birthday cake. Don't think I'd go back...

I live in NY and was looking for a bakery in Las Vegas that offered both vegan options and delivery.  I was so pleasantly surprised to find such a charming bakery online.  Their website suggests 24 hours notice for vegan orders; however, these guys were so amazing that they accommodated my request on the same day. What is more, they even worked with me to get the cupcakes delivered since I live across the country.  Retro Bakery has some of the best costumer service I've ever experienced. I only wish that I were there to taste what I'm sure were amazing cupcakes. I could extol the virtues of Retro Bakery for many paragraphs. Instead I will conclude with the strongest possible recommendation. Run don't walk to Retro.
We ordered our daughters bday cake from here. I was really disappointed with taste. So dry and too sweet.

Talk About All These Cupake/Bakery Places, That seem to be Popping Up Left and Right! I'm No Sugar Junky nor Cake Feen of any sort but this place Transforms me into A CUPCAKE MONSTER!!!!! *RRRRRAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHRRRRRR!!!!!!!*

First Time, I had the Honor to try this Whimsical Place, I had no Idea what was coming.... Every Flavor Offered Looked Like Winning Combinations?! So Ordering Every Single Cupcake would solve the Dilemma?! Well, that's exactly what happened.. I had the chance to try ALL (24) of their current cupcake creations at the time, including the cupcake of that day (I guess this changes daily or so..)! Since this place was quite a drive and the staff did advise that the cupcakes could be placed in the freezer and would stay fresh for a few months, I had time to devour them in a more realistic pace.. That Sealed the Deal! Alright, sounds Dandy to me, lets do it!

Literally Every Single Cupcake was PHENOMENAL!!!!! But here's a few that Tantalized my Taste Buds and made a statment that Stuck on Me, Permanently:

Hop Scotch ("OUR #1 SELLER): There's a reason it's their #1! "Vanilla cake topped with vanilla buttercream dipped in butterscotch ganache"

Peanut Butter Cup: If you like Reese's, then this should inspire you!

Cinnamon Toast: Remember the cereal "Cinnamon Toast Crunch".. Well, this took me on a blast to the past!

Red Carpet: Like red velvet.. their almond buttercream topping does bring it up a couple notches and steers away from the typical velvet cakes.

Mint Chocolate Chip: "Thrifty's" or "Baskin Robbins" Ice Cream was the first thing that came to my Mind.. True Classic, without a Cone and it didn't Melt!

This is Undeniably an Honorable Institution and their cupcakes should be regarded as a Vegas Staple! I could only 'ZzzZZDREAMZZzzZ' of cupcakes being this Asteroid Shattering, Earth Shaking and Comet Shooting AMAZING, to say the Least!!!!

Came here to get some treats for my birthday. Having never been here before, I asked the friendly gal what she could recommend and what was popular. She immediately said that if I wanted white cake, to try the butterscotch one (the official name has slipped me) but that if I wanted chocolate, they have a cupcake with both milk and dark chocolate. Not leaning toward one or the other, we decided to get both. They had a wide selection of other cupcakes too, but if you are new to a place, best to ask what is good to get. 

We didn't eat our cupcakes right away, which is why I gave this place 4 stars. We saved them, in the bag, for about 8 hours till after dinner that day. The cake was moist, though you could tell that the elements had begun to get to it-not too much but I could notice. The chocolate cupcake was my favorite!? It wasn't too chocolatey at all, and I was surprised that the dark and milk chocolates didn't overpower one another. The butterscotch one was delish too. Butterscotch isn't my favorite flavor, but it surprised me. Not too sweet, and I liked the choice of the white cake to accompany it. I found it to be sweet too.

I'd definitely come back and try their other flavors. Oh, and bonus--if you need candles, they have them reasonably priced here. Got 2 candles and 2 cupcakes for $5. Not a bad deal if you ask me!

It's Vegas, so why not have a shot glass full of frosting for $1?

Love the decor here at Retro Bakery! The employees even dress in a retro rockabilly style. Love the cute yellow retro fridge located behind the cash register which I'm told contains employee lunches. I romanticized that the fridge contained something cooler in there, like an old fashioned jello mold waiting to set.  I'm going to imagine that the employee lunches consists of retro items, like deviled eggs.

The #1 selling cupcake at Retro Bakery is the Hopscotch. The vanilla buttercream frosting is dipped in butterscotch and all that yumminess sits atop a simple vanilla cupcake. 

The texture of the hopscotch reminds me of a Dairy Queen dipped cone. It has that chewy toothsome bite reminiscent of a freshly dipped cone. The plain vanilla cupcake is subtly moist. The vanilla buttercream frosting on it's own, has a bit of a grainy sugar crystal texture, but strangely, it's still not too sweet.

Retro Bakery is one of those fantastic little places that make any day seem like a perfect one. The owners Kari and Brian ways have something new. Along with the outstanding array of cupcake flavors, they also offer the best cookies in Las Vegas and some flat out killer cakes (in cupcake flavors) plus individual pies. They've done our wedding cake as well as cakes for several other events in our family. 10/10, will keep coming back again and again!

Thank goodness Retro is less than 5 minutes from my house. Friendly service and delicious cupcakes makes me very happy. Went in the other day and asked for my favorites: vanilla cake with strawberry cream cheese frosting. This cupcake is the kind of cake you destroy in the car with no shame. Finger licking good and I'm not embarrassed at all for finishing  a cupcake in 4 bites. OH, and their sugar cookies! OMG, they are good. I do like to destroy my cookie at home because I need a cold glass of milk to wash it down. The rule I have for my diva is: no sharing, get your own. Momma wants it all to herself.

The inside of the bakery is cute and really lives up to it's name. The font, colors, and old school refrigerator adds to the ambiance making it both classic and contemporary. I really like the fact that they allow organizations to do fund raising cupcakes, which shows how much they care about the community! My church group has done it twice and it's easy to do considering the fact that Retro Bakery is so popular. Keri and her staff are also super nice and easy to work with. They really do care for their clientele and show the personal customer service everyone looks for in a locally owned business. I've tried an array of flavors and my favorite is the hopscotch. Although I do wish they didn't put as much butter cream and it tends to be on the sweet side for my preference.
I was an out-of-towner looking for a good cupcake. Pulled out Yelp and it didn't steer me wrong. The "glazed donut" was radical (actually better than a glazed donut).

I used Retro Bakery for my wedding cake. As an out-of-towner, I had to use Yelp to pick a bakery (thanks, Yelpers!). Retro had good reviews, so I called them and placed my order, which involved a two tier wedding cake and a vegan cupcake. I spoke a couple times on the phone, as well as emailed with the staff to confirm my order.

The good: The cake tasted phenomenal. Despite being stuffed after the meal, everyone wanted to eat the cake. It was moist, and the flavours were intense and authentic. The buttercream was also delicious! It tasted like it was made with authentic ingredients, not chemicals. 

The bad: Getting the cake delivered was a bit of a hassle, as the drivers kept calling with changes in plans. On your wedding day, this can be a bit hectic.

The ugly: They got the colour of my order wrong. Seriously wrong. I had asked for a white cake with Tiffany blue accents. The cake arrived and was entirely deep, bright, teal. Children's birthday cake teal. It would have been less bad if just the piping on the cake was that colour, but it was the entire cake! It looked like it belonged at a five-year-old's party. I laughed it off, but I'm not sure how this happened. Even if they thought the entire cake was supposed to be blue, I triple-checked with the person taking the order that they knew what I meant by "Tiffany Blue".  They did not.

Bottom line: It was incredibly good cake, and that's what mattered most to me. However, you are paying for the work that goes into decorating, and it would be good if they had gotten it right. Had the colour been right, I would have given them five stars, it was so delicious. It was also nicely decorated, despite being the wrong colour.

These cupcakes were awesome. I drove 26 miles there and 26 back. Worth it. By the time I reached home the cakes were ready to eat. The cream appears as if it would ne overpowering, but perfectly compliments the subtle sweetness of the cake. Next time I'll buy a dozen and attempt to store them. The red cake isn't exactly a red velvet, so you'll be disappointed if seeking that cream cheese taste. I had butterscotch, pb with chocolate and the red cake.  Yum!

I love Retro!!

I was planning my son's Christening and when it came to the cake, it was a toss up between Retro and Aracelli Zea.  I'd never been, but remembered having a Maple Bacon (one of my faves) cupcake from a friend and loving it, and after reading all the reviews, went with Retro (despite how f'in far it is from South Summerlin).

Brian is great to work with!  Exchanged a few emails with him and printed out some photos and schlepped over (as well as had a dozen cupcakes set aside to taste - they don't do cake tastings).  Handed my photos/details over, picked up my cupcakes (which he dropped to $20/dozen since I was buying a cake - how sweet), oogled at the ones I didn't get for a bit, and kid sis and I began our "tasting" in the car, lol.  It's a cute bakery with a clean, neat, and adorable store front.  They should sell milk (or you could walk over to the 7/11)!  

I recommend trying to get there early, bc I'm guessing they kept the cupcakes in the walk-in.. they were chilled and VERY different from a cupcake right from the case (they're still yummy, but were obviously cold, buttercream was stiff, and even thawed, a fresh one out of the case is a million times better)

Here's what I tried on my first visit:

Pucker up - one of my faves, great looking cupcake, moist, soft cake, tart buttercream, reminded me of a muffin.
Choc. fountain - yummm.
Vanilla/vanilla - moist cake, not too sweet buttercream.
Choc/vanilla - one of my faves.
Pink lemonade - not my fave.  :( the buttercream is too tart, kind of bitter and gritty.  I really wanted to like this, and I hate that I hate it!
Hop scotch - bc I had this chilled, it wasn't such a great experience the first time, but it was really yummy thawed.
Smores - idk, this was at the bottom for both of us.  Nice moist cake, but the marshmallow buttercream was kind of off, I can't really describe it.
Red carpet - moist, tasty cake, almond buttercream was kind of surprising and a little overwhelming (but I don't like almond flavoring.. if you like marzipan, you'll like the buttercream on this)
Salted caramel - I liked this!  I was expecting it to be saltier, but it was still good, I loved the pretzel on top.
Cookies & cream - This was good, I liked this better than the choc. fountain and salted caramel.
PB cup - I can't be fair, I'm not a big fan of PB so it was just okay. (I actually was supposed to have an Apple Cider set aside, minor mix up.)
Maple bacon - one of my faves, could use more bacon,  but it's perfect the way it is.

I exchanged a few (dozen) more emails with Brian and about a week before my event, stopped in to pay for my cake (they take half off your card about a week before the cake delivery) because I was on that side of town, and copped a few cupcakes for the ride home, lol.

Milk & cookies - one of my faves, one of the best choc. chip cookies I've ever had.
Apple cider - my fave!  I love breakfast pastries, and this is very muffin-like.

My event was on a Sunday, so since they're not open on Sundays, I had the cake delivered to me.  It came the night before and it was packed super snug and dummy-proof (with short instructions taped to the box), as I was uber paranoid with having to bring this to the venue myself.  It was perfect!!  SUCH a hit!  It definitely looked better in person, but I'll post photos.  It was a two tier (feeds 45 - dessert slices) 8"/10" round cake, covered in fondant.  I chose red carpet (as per request by mother dearest) for the larger tier and chocolate covered strawberry (YUM, could possibly knock apple cider off my #1) for the small tier.  It was a white cake, so both tiers made such great looking slices, white fondant with dark, dramatic cake.  I almost chose pucker up as the top tier, and I almost wish I did.

All Retro's cakes are moist and I think I read somewhere that their standard choc cake is vegan.  Buttercream is tasty and piped high in a cute swirl!

Retro has a great staff and delicious cupcakes!  I wish they were closer to me!!!

xxR
No need to write a review one u go there and eat one leave u speech less the cup cake are heave I swear god made them , best bakery in Vegas

These are hands down the most perfectly moist cupcakes I've ever had. even after sitting all day in the car. I highly recommend this place. Beware though, this place isn't exactly IN Vegas, more like 22 miles off the strip.

ICE TEA - Lemon Cupcake with Ice Tea frosting topped with a lemonhead.
HOPSCOTCH - Vanilla cake topped with vanilla buttercream dipped in butterscotch ganache.  Goddamn, this was so so good... It's like the butterscotch glaze kept the moisture in... I will eat you again.
TOASTED COCONUT - Toasted coconut cake topped with vanilla bean buttercream, toasted coconut, and sweetened condensed milk. This is the motherfucking most legit coconut cupcake I've ever had... and super moist to boot. Unfortunately it's seasonal. 
VANILLA WITH VANILLA/ORANGE TANG buttercream frosting. - Meh... I could barely taste the tang. 

Overall, I'm a very happy camper. Any cupcake (hopscotch & coconut) that makes me go "holy shit" after taking a bite is worth sharing. 
I will be back... either that or I will be requesting people who go to vegas to bring me back cupcakes.

I almost don't want to write the review because then I'll be fighting more people for these yummy cupcakes! BEST EVER!! I don't even like buttercream but they flavor it so perfectly, it's not too sweet & just so flavorful! 

my favorite is the cookie doh! everyone I've told about this place, it's become their favorite too! 

The drumstick is yummy too! It gets its name from the ice cream drumstick! 

Ladies there are awesome also

Amazing fresh cupcakes!! 
My husband and I loved them so much we ordered our wedding cake and my daughter's birthday cake.
Great prices and fabulous choices.  My husband loves the strawberry banana cupcakes. I'm a fan of the chocolate anything.

BEST cupcakes in Vegas by far! And I've tried a few...

I have had the pleasure of trying many of the daily cupcakes as well as monthly flavors. Every flavor I have had is out of this world! But my fav has to be the Maple Bacon...OMG! This is a great combo of sweet n salty. And anything that has crumbled bacon atop it, has my heart from the get!

Retro's cake is always moist and baked just as it should be. Accompanied by the right amount of sweetness from their unique frostings.

I love Retro Bakery and even though it's a little drive, I will def keep going back : )

I found Retro Bakery off of yelp and went out on a limb to have them make my 21st birthday cake for my celebration in Vegas (I'm from California). I'm extremely picky and was unable to do a tasting so I was so nervous. To my extreme satisfaction the cake came out better than expected! They designed it exactly how I asked and the design did not take away from the taste! It was one of the best cakes I've ever had! I will absolutely order from Retro Bakery again, probably every time I visit vegas!

Ok love love love there cupcakes. I purchased about 6 and enjoyed all of them. If your in the Vegas area and love cupcakes you have to try. It's a bit out of the way but worth it. Friendly service and plenty of yummy flavors to choose from. Five stars. All the way!

I ordered cupcakes from Retro Bakery for my wedding after reading the reviews, and I have to say they lived up to the expectations and more.

I ordered vanilla, chocolate and red velvet cupcakes and a small cookies and cream cake, they all were delicious!!! The cupcakes are really moist and the icing has just the right amount of sweetness.

Not only were the cupcakes great, but the service was awesome, they delivered everything perfectly and right on time.

Good cupcakes, good service, GREAT buttercream.  You can get a "shot of buttercream" if you wish and try various flavors.  The one critique that our whole family has about this place is that their white cupcakes are FAR better than their chocolate cupcakes.   They really need to tweak the recipe.  If you buy them in the afternoon, the chocolate cupcakes are very dry and have very little cocoa flavor.  On the flip side, if you go on a Friday, you can get the "Brownie Sundae" cupcake which is everything that a brownie should be...moist chewy and delicious...but with buttercream and fudge on top!   Wow!

Small little place so don't plan to sit there and eat what you buy.  It seems to be "take-out-only".

The price was a little higher than I would have hoped, but both the cookies and cupcakes were great!
Very friendly! Comparable to Freed's Bakery!! Now that is saying something!
Love this bakery. Recommend to people all the time! Beautiful and great tasting cakes and goodies! A must visit if your in the mood for a treat!

We have ordered about 5 cakes over the years here. We have stopped in for countless cupcakes!! Best tasting ever! 
Our last cake was a Mickey Mouse Clubhouse.... AMAZING

Retro Bakery has the most amazing cupcakes in town, hands down! Don't even try to argue with me on this!

I live in Spring Valley and they are located in the North West (practically to Mount Charleston), but they are worth the drive! Believe me. I am an avid Cupcake Enthusiast. 

I went in with a girlfriend yesterday, we order 5 cupcakes, sometimes I wish all places had pu pu platters (I want to taste is ALL). They were out of the Salted Caramel Crunch (which is what I was told to try) and Kari, said she'd make a few of them up for us, we didn't even have to ask!!! How awesome is that?

The cakes on each of the 5 we got were fluffy and moist. They weren't airy or dry or crusty and each one of them was pretty dense and heavy. I don't know the secret to her frosting, but every different type I got to indulge in was epically awesome. Not too sweet, not too oily, not too bland. They were PERFECT.

The bakery was nice and clean. It had a 1950s refrigerator that added ambiance and tied in to the whole "retro" concept. Retro is tucked away in a shopping center, there is limited seating, I think I saw one love seat. I wish they had hot coffee, a few tables, and this place would be complete.

This is place really knocked my socks off! The cupcakes were fresh, there was an wide range assortment of varieties and flavor profiles. The staff was friendly, informative, and helpful. 

I wish I lived closer, but at the same time I am thankful I don't. I can only imagine the calorie count, but when cupcakes are made like this (PERFECTION, HEAVEN, JOYGASM IN MY MOUTH) it's hard to not rationalize the calorie intake!

Well done, Retro Bakery, well done. Bravo! I will be back.

We ordered a Red Velvet Wedding Cake to celebrate our nuptuals on 1/11/11 and became addicts immediately after the first bite!  OMG, delicious, the almond really made the cake stand out from all the other red velvet cakes and cupcakes we try whenever we can! 
We were able to take the leftovers with us home and I guarded the cake with my life through airport security and the plane ride home. We were able to enjoy for days later as our special treat.
The cake was dense and moist, really good!.  I have tried to find a recipe to duplicate at home, no luck, but I will persevere until we make it back to vegas to have the real deal.
YUMMY!!!!!!!!

I stopped in here on July 4th because I wanted a few sweets for the evening. I went with the banana cupcake with strawberry buttercream frosting because the girl up front said it was her very favorite. Then I asked what she recommended between the glazed donut cupcake and the birthday cupcake and she said glazed. I also ordered the chocolate chip cookie because when a bakery offers one I have to try it. 

The overall consensus on all the cupcakes was that they were sickeningly sweet. The glazed donut cake part was very bland and the glaze on top tasted like nothing. The strawberry buttercream frosting was just overly sweet. It has potential because they do use fresh strawberries but it does not need all the excess sugar. The chocolate chip cookie wasn't bad it was just super average.

All these high reviewers must like the overly sweet baked goods that Retro Bakery serves.

Being spoiled on the east coast with a handful of gourmet cupcake spots, I have to say the ones at Retro are only OK in my books.  We got a dozen of them and of the ones I had so far, the frosting is not what I had expected.  It's a buttercream, which is great, but I found it a little dry and not moist and smooth.  

I bit into the toffee break and you can really taste the richness of the chocolate cake.  Good stuff, I like how it's dense and moist.  The pieces of toffee blend well as far as textures.  Another one I had was the mint chocolate chip.  The mint flavor in the frosting is bold and you can really taste it.  Personally, I didn't like it too much.  The next one I tasted was the cinnamon toast.  The frosting in this was was way BOLD, you can really taste the cinnamon flavor and I think it was a little overpowering and you couldn't taste the cake at all.  My second bite, I had to take the frosting in half.

Haven't got to taste the rest of the variety pack yet, but I'll probably expect similar results.  Anyway, decent gourmet cupcake place, there are other ones in the DC area which are better.  At $2.50/each, I have to say this is a good price compared to what I've paid for these little bad boys elsewhere.

Used them for my wedding. Everything was perfect from start to finish!  They helped us pick flavors and estimate how many we would need.  They confirmed the order a few days before the wedding.  On the wedding day they delivered and set up on time.  And of course the cupcakes were delicious.  My guests loved them!  We got the mini ones so people could try different flavors.  The Red Carpet is to die for!
Cupcakes are always amazing!!! And the cakes look incredible. I've been going since they opened and 5 years later they're better than ever!

This place is superb. The cupcakes are delicious and the service is stellar. I needed a last minute birthday cake and they accommodated me quickly. The triple chocolate cake was to die for! The cupcakes are beautiful and you can tell the owners love what they do. They are passionate about making it a good experience. My favorite is the red velvet, but the drumstick is fantastic too!

Not only was my cousin's baby shower cake absolutely adorable, it has to be the best cakes I've tasted in a really long time. It was a special order owl cake design with white cake and chocolate filling. The party was a huge hit and people were so impressed by the cake. I heard several people mention that it was the best they've had in Vegas. Great job! I highly recommend! 

The best part? The team working in the store. Everyone smiling, super friendly and very helpful. It's hard to find places that still believe in treating their customers right. Thanks again!

The name brought me in and since I love all things BAKED GOODS, I had to try their specialty cupcakes.  We only had two (one for each child) and they were a pretty big size but with a tad bit too much frosting.  Still very tasty and presentation nice. Kids wanted chocolate. They did have a variety of fun flavors and names to match.

I was also lucky enough to see them in action at my friends wedding.  The "cake" was  all cupcakes from Retro with a variety of flavors.  The theme was Las Vegas so cupcakes were decorated accordingly (decks of cards, Las Vegas sign, etc)  all stacked up in a tier.  Again, we went with the chocolate and it was sooooo good!  Don't miss this if you're in this neck of the woods! Friendly service too:)

I am a cupcake fanatic. The cupcakes were smaller than other bakeries, but the variety of flavors was appealing. We got a half dozen: coffee and donut, chocolate Fountain, cookies and cream, butterscotch, birthday cake, and another I can't remember.  They were just ok. Some the cake was really dry and dense, others just didn't have much flavor at all. I also asked about a very basic cake to be made, literally a circle cake with  a simple design on the side. They said they needed 14 days. 14 days! That's way too long. Every other bakery is generally one week, unless it's a huge custom order. I took my order to Albertsons. We usually go to Drago Sisters Bakery in the SW but thats tok far for this party. Basic cupcakes, basic cakes. We won't be returning.

I have Been going to Retro Bakery since they opened.. my sub-division is right behind the store.. Kari-Hubby and Staff are the Best.. The Cupcakes are the Tastiest in town.. I don't go anywhere else for cupcakes but here.. once you have these you really get spoiled.. nothing can compare..not even close. Also  The cakes are so moist and rich they are scrumptious!!!  you will get spoiled with these.. :-)

Copying & pasting my review from my tumblr. Pics and stuff included on http://joijam.tumblr.com/page/2 if you wanna see em :-)

"In Vegas we went to this bakery called Retro Bakery. It was better than The Cupcakery (in my opinion). Don't get me wrong, The Cupcakery was good too, but I went to Retro Bakery more than once (shame on me!). There was so much to try and (one of) the owners, Brian, was super nice. I didn't meet his wife, the other owner though. The gals behind the counter were sweet as pie and they remembered us when we went back. I fell in love with the sugar cookies. They were so good, I didn't even want any more cupcakes! Now that's something! My only complaint is that the cookies had frosting on them. I scraped it off because they're so tasty the frosting isn't even necessary (again, my opinion). They looked like their cookie pictured above with the Johnny Cupcakes logo, minus the logo and with colored sugar. Honestly, my own cookies didn't survive long enough to have a photo op so I had to use that cookie from their Flickr. See more of their work here. I won't say how many trips we made, but I will be going back next time I'm in Vegas."

Update: Went back to Vegas and the owner is still super cool, the treats are still deelish, and they are still better than The Cupcakery! This will continue to be my favorite cupcake spot in Vegas. Long live Retro!

Haven't had Retro for a long time, so I decided to swing by and do a little "taste test".
There are many cupcake shops here in town, and Retro is a popular favorite among locals.

We tried the Maple Bacon, Coffee and Doughnuts, Cotton Candy, and Milk & Cookies.
These have cool names and all, but the buttercream tends to be on the overly sweet side,(at least for me) and on a couple of the cupcakes, it wasn't as moist as I was expecting. Totally still a fan though, and I love the fact that they are in my hood! ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(323/365) "Retro Rocks!"

I took my out-of-town friend here since she loves cupcakes.  I was thinking about taking her to my favorite cupcakery but I figured, I need to do myself a favor and try something new.  They open early and they're friendly even at 9am!

We got Big Kahuna (pina colada), Hop Scotch (butterscotch), Red Carpet (red velvet), Milk & Cookies, Chocolate Fountain,  Drumstick, Pistachio, Pink Lemonade, Cherry Cheesecake, Cotton Candy, Pucker Up and Maple Bacon.  They're yummy and quite pretty.  My favorites are (in order of preference): pistachio, Drumstick, Big Kahuna, Cherry Cheesecake and Maple Bacon.  The packaging is simple (white box) and nothing fancy.  The cupcakes aren't expensive but they make sure you eat them within 2 days max.  They don't keep very well which means they don't use preservatives.
great cake. absolutely disgusting frosting. way too thick and tastes like store bought.
I chose Retrobakery to do my wedding cake 4/4/14. They were AMAZING!! Everyone loved our cake and they were so easy to work with! Flavors they have are soooo yummy!

Retro Bakery did my wedding cupcakes. I had vanilla on vanilla cupcakes, Peanut Butter Cup Cupcakes with a Vanilla on Vanilla mini cake. People still rave about how amazing my cupcakes were. They delivered and were so delish I still think about them.

I had a very hard time placing a custom order for my wedding with this place.
I contacted them via email over a month in advanced of my event date. Who I was speaking with made me feel as if they were uninterested to take my order. They told me my order was simple and they only needed 24 hours notice. Keep in mind we discussed that I needed 14 dozen cupcakes, a small cake, with delivery and set up. I thought they would have been appreciative of my far in advanced notice for an order like that. So 2 weeks before my event date I contacted them to order and they told me they were all booked up. They could still do a small cake with no delivery and set up if I wanted. I ended up going somewhere else.

My overall experience with this place was not good. I would never recommend them for anyones up coming event.

Retro bakery is a delicious little cupcake cake and cookie bakery nestled into A little shopping center across from Albertson's in Centennial Hills off of Durango and Farm Avenue.

Every time I come here I am greeted warmly then quickly overwhelmed with the delicious smells of baked goods. I've tried several of the cupcakes which I found to be quite delicious but very sweet. I love the butterscotch cupcake and the carrot cake as well. One of my favorite baked goods from here is the chocolate Chip peanut butter cookie. The cookies here are all delicious, giant and are only $1.50

Overall I would highly recommend coming in trying their cupcakes and cookies. They are one of the best bakeries in the Centennial Hills area and you will not be disappointed.

One last thing, all of the cupcakes look absolutely fantastic! Retro bakery takes great pride in the presentation and they do a fantastic job of making them look irresistible

Also part of my weekend pre-low carb binge.  I was in the vicinity of Retro as part of the nye festivites which included , Babycakes cafe and Aliante.  the gf has never tried Retro so we decided to get a sampling and eat them on New Years.  Picked up red velvet, peanut butter/chocolate, maple bacon,  they were out of the peppermint ...damn !  gf had something with coffee in it, also the drumstick . 

 Retro makes the best frosting ...period !

Had to deduct a star because the chocolate based cupcakes were too dry.  The white cake - perfectly moist.

It's probably a good thing these guys are too far from my house

We were totally living under a rock!  Been living in the Centennial Hills area for almost three years and NEVER knew of Retro...until now.  Picked up cupcakes today - the Red Carpet is delish!!  Moist cake, crazy almond buttercream frosting.  The cake flavor goes perfect with the frosting.  My husband LOVED the Peanut Butter Cup.  Peanut Butter Buttercream - he couldn't resist.  We are cupcake fans, and now they are right down the street.  Can't wait to try other flavors and the cookies.  They make custom cakes too.  (Check out their website.) Best bakery in Centennial Hills, by far.

We ordered our wedding cake from Retro, and were less than pleased with the cake we received. Although it tasted as delicious as we expected, it did not look as
we expected. Unfortunately, when it comes to wedding cakes that are such a large part of the photographs, the visual presentation is just as important as the taste.

We requested a specific cake from Brian, which we had found a photo of on Retro's custom cake website. We sent Brian a link to the specific cake we wanted, which should have allievated any confusion.  However, after we placed the order, we found out the quote we were given was for butter cream (which has an entirely different look than we requested)
instead of the fondant that was pictured in the photo we sent. It was also a significant price increase over the butter cream, but because we live out of state, it was too late to research and find another bakery.

Brian told us the flower decorations on the cake we requested were no longer available, but that he would be able to make them himself, and that they would be even better. The flowers we ended up with on our cake were not at all what we had requested, and were blue instead of the teal we had asked for (we even sent a photo of one of Retro's previous cakes that was the exact color that we wanted). Our cake ended up looking like it belonged in someone else's child's birthday party, instead of our wedding. Wrong look, wrong flowers, wrong color, and several of the flowers had broken and fallen off of the cake (although this could have been the fault of our reception venue as well?).

Although we loved the flavors of the cake, we would definitely not recommend them for creating a *wedding* cake.  We do not think it is an unreasonable expectation for a bakery to recreate a style of cake and a color scheme based on cakes that they list in their cake gallery.  If they were unable to do so, they should have let us know so that we could have planned differently.

Ok I've officially tried almost every flavor they make and I can say for sure that these are the best cupcakes in town. And well worth the insane drive to the northern-most edge of town. The chocolate loves vanilla (chocolate cake with vanilla buttercream) is still my fav, but close seconds include the cookies and cream (chocolate cake with Oreo buttercream) and the pucker up (raspberry cake- real raspberries not dye- with lemon buttercream).
